intro: Picria surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam picria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and it produces small yellow flowers in umbels. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts when mature.
